utterance.speaker: Wife
utterance.content: Excuse me, waitress?

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: I'm afraid the teriyaki chicken's no longer on the menu.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: Oh, I'm sorry. That's what you had last time.

utterance.speaker: Wife
utterance.content: We've never been here before.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: I definitely remember you.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: Your hair was lighter. You had little round glasses.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Sounds like you.

utterance.speaker: Wife
utterance.content: Henry, don't play along. It's a gimmick, for tips. Could we get some water?

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: It was last August. Saturday, the 14th. You were wearing a blue dress with polka dots. Your eyes were puffy, like you'd been crying.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: The 14th is Darren's birthday. You said he had to cancel his party 'cause his old girlfriend showed up. They got into a huge fight.

utterance.speaker: Wife
utterance.content: Henry…

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I knew it. Damn it. Ever since that ski trip when the two of you disappeared.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: I'll go… get your water.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Are you all right? Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: I can't move my legs!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Picture a door. Unlocked with the key of the mind. Two medical cases, both more fascinating than the last.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: That actually makes no logical sense.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is not a door to logical sense. Also, shut up. Case number one. 33-year-old woman named…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Something I can't remember. You'll see the irony in a second. Presenting with temporary paralysis, high CK levels, and a perfect memory.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How perfect is perfect?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Perfectly perfect. Hyperthymesia. Complete recall of every moment of every day since puberty. All 7,600,049 of them. It's cool, huh? One of only a handful of recorded cases.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So we have two symptoms: Temporary leg paralysis and elevated CK.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Obviously you're not suffering from the same condition 'cause you've already forgotten my dramatic voiceover. There's a third symptom.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Her memory's unrelated.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Why? It's a strange medical phenomenon—

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hyperthymesia is known to manifest in adolescence.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, in the whole five documented cases.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: To be related, it would mean 20 years between symptoms. Plus, I don't know of any diseases that cause great memory, only ones that destroy it. MRI showed no evidence of stroke or tumor, so probably a toxin.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She's a waitress. They're no strangers to botulism or alcoholism. We should search the diner and where she lives.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or you could search her brain. You know, where her memory lives. Save the gas. You two check her home. You two get a complete patient history. We'll see who gets an answer first.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You said there's a second case?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh! Yeah. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The case of the 45-year-old doctor who just failed his pathology recertification exam and is going to lose his board certification and get fired.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How'd you fail it? You spend half your life in the lab.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I was recovering from the flu. I'm retaking it next week. It's not an issue.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Normally, I'd let Darwinism run its course. But Cuddy's in a big tizzy about her poster boy getting canned. So, how are we gonna get the short guy off the short bus?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: What about a tutor?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I don't need a tutor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tutor it is. Choose your poison. Chase, if you prefer pounding Aussie beers and commiserating over the suckiness of divorce. Masters, if you want nervous energy, flash cards, and obnoxious pieces of arcane trivia. Foreman, if you need to be berated by a humorless hard-ass.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Foreman.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Interesting. You must be more worried than you look.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I need a consult, Dr. Wilson.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So call me in a week if it still itches.

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: Thank you. And be sure to give Sarah a kiss for me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Will do.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who's Sarah?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Her granddaughter, I think. Early stages of dementia. What's the consult?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I need your medical opinion on what bar we're gonna hit for happy hour tonight to kick off the official end to your three-month pity party over Sam.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I can't tonight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because of Sarah?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes, because of my senile patient's granddaughter. You caught me. I'm busy!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who's Sarah? Wilson's friend.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: My computer crashed. Lost my database of his acquaintances.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or you're both lying to me.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I know nothing about Wilson having a friend named Sarah. Satisfied?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nooo.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What are the eight types of vomitus?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I could show you four right now if you ask me one more review question.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hey, you picked me. You said you wanted a hard-ass.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No, House said that. I pretended to agree to get him off my back. I picked you because I wanted the guy who doesn't like getting involved in other people's problems.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yes, I thought you'd want to skip the massive public humiliation of getting fired.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: By treating me like I'm an imbecile? I'm totally fine. I aced my first pathology boards.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Medicine has come a long way in the last hundred years.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You know… I heard of a guy, who knew a guy, who could get the exam ahead of time. It was something I heard.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Patient's file said she lost some weight on a new diet, right?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yeah, she went vegan.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Are laxatives vegan?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Where are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: In the parking garage, searching Wilson's car.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We have an answer. Magnesium poisoning.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We found a pretty large stash of laxatives. Abuse can lead to hypermagnesemia.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I admit that's… impressively outside-the-box thinking. Hmm.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House. You still there, House?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Everything okay?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. For a second I thought Wilson might have a drug problem. Turns out it's much, much worse.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Okay… Uh, so we push fluids and wait for her kidneys to clear the hypermagnesemia?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You'll be waiting a long time since that's not what she has. Her BP and respiratory rate are normal. While you two were so busy being impressively outside the box, you missed the actual box. Chase and Masters done yet?

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: Two light beers, November 16th. One really bad glass of Pinot on the 17th. Uh, nothing from the 18th.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Shouldn't you be working for NASA or something?

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: You mean why am I just a waitress?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: No, I didn't mean… I'm sorry, I-I-I-I…

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: It's okay. Remembering something is not the same as understanding it. I'm not a genius. I love my job. I'm great at it. Keeps my mind busy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hi. I'm Dr. House. You are not pooping. Question is, are you also a klutz?

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: Uh… I guess I'm no clumsier than most people.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What are you guessing for? You've got a perfect memory. I was told there'd be numbers, dates, fireworks.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: What do you want to know?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Let's go back to 2008. How many trips, stumbles, falls did you have?

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: Eleven.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This really works. Cool. How 'bout 2009?

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: Twelve.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Even cooler. Last year?

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: Twenty.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That's a big spike in discoordination.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you add the constipation, it's early onset Parkinson's. Give her a full neuro exam, and start her on levodopa.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh, I'm so surprised you broke into my apartment without telling me. What is this?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: An intervention. Exhibit A. A baggie filled with nepeta cataria, also known as…

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That had better not be what I think it is.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you mean your new junkie girlfriend, then yes.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House…

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay, fine. I got a cat. Release the Kraken.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't think you appreciate the severity of your situation. You are rapidly approaching an end-stage male spinsterism.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That cat, that diabetic cat that you're shooting up with Insulin and buying dime bags of catnip for, that means you've given up on ever finding anyone.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Don't you think you're completely overreacting?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If I'm completely overreacting, why'd you lie to me?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Um, because I knew you would completely overreact.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Its name's Sarah. Cats aren't named that, women are. What the Freud is that about?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Look, I didn't name her. My neighbor did. She died, and I felt bad. Sarah would have been destroyed at the shelter.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Aww, who would want a cat that croaks if you're not home twice a day to shoot it up? It's like having your own button on Lost. You know, I'm pretty sure that there is a river nearby.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm keeping her.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Okay, shrug your shoulders and don't let me push them down. So I have to ask, uh… is there a trick you use? Mnemonics? Meditation?

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: No, no tricks. I don't even try, really. It's just there. Is my memory gonna go away… with the Parkinson's?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's quite possible. But we still have a lot of tests to do before we have a definitive diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: Well, here's hoping for cancer.

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: Nadia? Your boss called me. Sorry, um… I'm Elena, Nadia's older sister.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: You don't have to be here.

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: But I'd like to pretend you'd visit me if I were in a hospital.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: You brought daisies.

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: They're your favorite.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: No, they're my least favorite. I was stung in the face six times by — Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: My heart.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Fast, wide-complex rhythm. Get the paddles.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Cardiac involvement rules out Parkinson's.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We're back to transient paralysis and high CK, plus arrhythmia.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Masters, when you finally blossom into a woman, would you ever sleep with a man who had a cat?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wrong, the answer is no. Slut. Any of you ever had a cat? Any of you ever had sex? I think, as your people say, quod erat demonstrandum.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: An excess of catecholamine could set off an arrhythmia.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's not a pheo. Her blood pressure's fine.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Maybe we're missing the obvious. The heart could be behind everything. If it's not pumping effectively, the muscles shut down, CK elevates, coordination suffers. Why are you asking about cats?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Curiosity. Can we focus here?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Uh, her heart problems started when Nadia saw her sister. Stress-induced arrhythmia could be caused by long QT syndrome.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Her sister was barely in the room five minutes.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: She said they'd been estranged for over six years. That's a lot of tension.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Run a stress test to confirm long QT.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It'll have to be drug-induced. Treadmill will pull her stitches.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Drugs are never the answer. If we want her heart to go crazy, there's something simpler and safer. Use the sister.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You lied to me.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No. I said I didn't know anything about Wilson having a friend named Sarah. Under House rules, that is not a lie. He's lonely. That cat is a nice way for him to get some affection.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's not the kind of putty tat he needs to be getting it from. He needs a putty tat he can tap.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Why is it so important to you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: After divorce number two, he fell into a committed relationship with a three-legged Siamese. He stopped answering his phone, redecorated his place like Grey Gardens. He wasn't able to come back to humanity until a window was left suspiciously and heroically open. How that cat opened the window, I will never know.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: He just needs more time. Leave him and the cat alone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I won't if you will.

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: Sorry about the daisies. I always get it confused if you love or hate them.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: Do you want to know exactly how many times told you that I hate them?

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: I didn't do it on purpose.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Her heart rate isn't moving. The sister stress pot needs stirring.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You want me to start a fight? No.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Just agitate a little. Use something from the history. You're not lying to them. In fact, you'd be telling the truth, and serving their medical needs.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You haven't seen each other in a while, huh? I heard the story about the time you hit Nadia with the car. It must have been pretty scary.

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: Why would you tell them that?

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: They asked about broken bones.

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: I swear that I checked my mirror.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: You know that's a lie. You knew I was getting the mail, and you just didn't care enough to check! Just like you didn't care that you ruined my 23rd birthday!

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: Nadia, don't start!

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: You started by coming here, acting like you give a crap.

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: Here we go again! I'm such a monster because I brought daisies.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You-you need to leave right now.

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: Well is she gonna be ok?

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: Elena, get out!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You said you'd be ten minutes.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I couldn't decide on the cheese.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: When are you getting an apartment? Or at least a storage room?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'll get to it. I like it here. They have video on demand.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I pulled a practice test.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I hate practice tests. Hey, I never saw The Usual Suspects. You wanna check it out before we start?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What are you doing? You've got three days.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why is everyone's first assumption I'm gonna fail this stupid test?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Maybe, because you did.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I was recovering from the flu.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I don't care if you were dying from ebola. You shouldn't have gotten less than a 70. You're nothing but excuses and distractions.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Well it's a nice match with your condescension and superiority.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Enjoy the movie. Kevin Spacey is Keyser Soze.

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: How is she?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We started her on a beta blocker. It should keep her heart rhythm under control. She'll be fine while we run more tests.

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: Did you hear that she banned me from her room? I know I'm not perfect, but she's… Oh, she can be such a bitch. She never ever, ever lets anything go. Look, tell Nadia she doesn't need to worry about seeing me again.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I started the fight. We needed her heart rate to rise, so I provoked you.

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: You can't play with people like that.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Maybe if I explain to Nadia—

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: No, it doesn't matter! It's just one more fight for her to remember. Guess you're both bitches.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Masters.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Smell her breath. Breathe out.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Ammonia.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I think your kidneys are shutting down.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Failing kidneys puts the heart back on the list as a symptom.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Maybe she went vegan because she lost the taste for protein. It could be Amyloidosis.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We would have seen a stiff heart on the nuclear study. But autoimmune could account for multiple organ systems and paralysis.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: There are a number that'd fit. Guillain-Barre, polymyositis…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: MS, polyarteritis nodosa—

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: SLE.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Why are you giving me these?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because, while they're off running all these tests, you will be submitting the insurance forms.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There's an entire department for that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Exactly. The Foreman department. Of which you are the foreman, Foreman. I know you got the time. A little Wallaby told me that you recently vacated your post as Taub's savior.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He asked.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're worse than Masters.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: How's this my fault?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He doesn't need a tutor. He needs Ritalin and a babysitter.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Consider the forms incentive. Taub doesn't pass, he'll become a permanent part of your life.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: This isn't really about Cuddy, is it? It's about you. You don't want to lose me. I think you care.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't think you can disgust me into pulling Foreman off you. Pulse the patient with steroids for the autoimmune. Start her on dialysis for the kidney failure. Treat the Taub with insults and small slaps for the obstinacy, and start him on studying for the brain failure.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, that's not gonna work. I have a haircut at 4 o'clock. I'll be in the offi— I'll be in the office in about 20 minutes. Yeah, okay.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You planted something in my apartment to make me think I'm allergic to Sarah.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Paranoia is the first sign of toxoplasma gondii, the parasite linked to crazy cat lady disease.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm not paranoid. I'm allergic to ragweed and dandelion. I'm not allergic to cats. You're trying to gaslight me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Maybe your subconscious is afraid that you're gonna die alone. And it just comes out as gibberish and sneezing. Prove that I'm overreacting. Boys' night out. Good Time Charlie's. They just changed their slogan to, "where the trashiest ladies

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You do see the hypocrisy in all this, don't you? Until recently, your lifestyle of choice was self-exile.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But I never had a cat. Why don't you pick me up at 8:00?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're gonna need another round of steroids. In the meantime, I'll start your dialysis. So I heard Elena might be coming back.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: You think I was… too hard on her?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, we all hold our grudges.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: It's not a grudge. It's common sense. It's simple math. She's hurt me more than she's helped me. Most people edit their memories. They add small, little lies so they don't have to face the truth. My memories remain the same. My truth never changes, because… my truth is the truth.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So no one ever gets forgiven? Sounds like a lonely way to live.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: No, I-I do forgive. As long as the good things they do… outweigh— I can't-I can't breathe.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Nothing, I just… always pictured your place with shag carpet. Like kind of a… Mod Squad vibe. Not because of the black thing. I always thought you were more of…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're limited to this room and Marcus's old room.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Where's Marcus?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He tells me he's working with our Uncle in Florida.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He tells you?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You don't look at or touch anything that doesn't belong to you, including food. You will study and you will sleep. And you will not leave my sight until the exam.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Great, I'll be back bright and early tomorrow, and—

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: This is no longer just about your future. It's about mine too. You fail, and I will kill you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Respiratory distress means we were wrong about autoimmune.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Could be pulmonary edema from renal failure.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pulmonary edema doesn't give you hives.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You think this is an allergic reaction? It can't be. We pumped her full of steroids.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It can be. If it was a really, really bad one.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have good news and bad news. The good news is I was right about you having some autoimmune disease. You're just allergic to the dialysis.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: But if I can't have dialysis and my kidneys are failing, won't that mean I'll die?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, you figured out the bad news.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: What do we do?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We look for another case. Even if you're right about autoimmune, we now don't have time to prove it. The transplant board will never give her a kidney.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Maybe we could go around them, get a relative to donate.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Which relative? The sister who walked away and told you she was never coming back?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We caused this, you know. They were estranged, but we made it worse.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That relationship was broken long before we got there. Nadia literally keeps score. She tallies everything. She decided Elena's done more bad things to her than good, doesn't deserve her affection.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm sure she's right. Unlike everybody else in the world, her memory seems to let her keep a pure and objective view of people in relationships. There's no petty

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: 'Cause it's making her die alone of kidney failure in room 205?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not necessarily. Nadia's sister's not like her. I'm sure she's got plenty of subjective emotions we can exploit. Why don't you go channel your guilt, see if you can get her to cough up a kidney?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Me? I'm not good at that type of thing. Someone else should go.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Someone else didn't screw this up.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I didn't!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were just obeying orders. Right? Go fix this.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Wha—

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I didn't mean to make you hate her. And… now that her kidneys have failed, I-I've always been a book and equations person. People are problematic, and… random and messy. Um, and with sisters… I mean, I had a cousin who I was close to, and when our menstrual cycles synced, it was like gladiator school—

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: Do you want me to donate a kidney to my sister?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Really? It might not fix your relationship. Uh, probably shouldn't have said that.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Your left, on your left.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Stop whining already. I was getting a sniper.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Five minutes left in the break.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: But the next level's just past the cooling tanks.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That was the deal. We take this break, you do a practice test.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I-I didn't have the flu. I just… choked.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You make life and death decisions every day. You work for House. You're under constant pressure, and you never choke.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I got a perfect score on my first pathology boards. I kept thinking, whatever my score is now, it's going to be a measure of the distance between me and the man

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You gotta stop psyching yourself out.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Well, the last test was before I lost my wife and my home, so I'm sure the next one will go much better.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sometimes, I wake up in the middle of the night, and I can't sleep for hours, 'cause I'm worried I got the diagnosis wrong. These things work out.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We found a donor. It's your sister. Just thought you should know.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Nadia, can you hear me? You're coming out of your anesthesia. You're gonna feel a bit groggy. You did great. Everything's looking good. Nadia, come on now, open your eyes.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Three milligrams of lorazepam, and I'm going to need suction.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Seizures mean the steroids aren't working.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: And we got the tests back. We were wrong. It's not autoimmune.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Could be acute porphyria.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: No abdominal pain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did the patient thank her sister?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No. Not yet, at least.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: See if she will.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: What are you trying to find out?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If she's telling the truth. She claims she objectively sees reality. Weighing the good and bad in people. If that's true, I don't care how many times her sister borrowed her scrunchie without asking, a free kidney ought to trump all the bad stuff.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: And if it doesn't?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That means she sucks like the rest of us.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We haven't considered her blood. Clots could hit her leg, heart, kidney, and brain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Factor 5 leiden. Easiest to treat if we're right. Start her on heparin. And ask for the thank you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How'd I do?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Great? How great? How many did I miss?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's not about the numbers. Don't…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Th-they make the practice tests harder than the actual exam.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Oh, my God, now I'm choking in your living room. This isn't gonna work.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Who are you calling?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I found the guy. He can sell me a copy of the test. I know it's cheating, and I suck as a person. But… the test is tomorrow morning.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's not about the cheating. It's about your confidence. You steal that test, and you'll never get it back.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I can't handle failing at one more thing in my life.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're a good doctor. I've seen what you're capable of. You're fast, you're decisive, and you're bold. And those are not the qualities of someone who needs to steal a test. There's nothing on it that you don't already know. You just need to know that you know it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Keep talking.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We need you on the team. So we're gonna sit here and take another practice test and we're gonna keep taking them until you've kicked its ass! You can do this! You feel me?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I feel like we just buried a hooker in the desert.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There'll definitely be another time to rise up and turn things around. You'll come back from it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Next time.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How are you feeling?

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: N-not any better.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It'll take some time for the clots to resolve. Your sister's recovering well. If you're really adding up the good and bad…

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: Can I see her?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Too fat. Too thin. Too desperate. Not desperate enough. Come on, you can insult them too.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'd rather not.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you objectify them now, you'll feel more comfortable when you… tie them to a table in your basement later. Or whatever.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay. Um… Too armpit fatty.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Whoa! Too hot.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I actually know her. She's the new barista at my coffee shop. She's getting her Masters in finance.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Brains and boobs. The mother lode.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Total moron as a barista, though. Every drink I order ends up with

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Girlfriend, that means she's into you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hi, there. Wilson, James Wilson. I'm a doctor. I'm hoping that's enough to close, because I'm also a social moron. And I have a cat.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She said my coffee is not the only thing she'd like to put whipped cream on.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, but is she interested?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bartender! Champagne for everyone!

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: Hi. Thank you. For saving my life.

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: I love you, you know.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: I was thinking about those times we went up to Spofford Lake in the summer. Whenever we took out the canoe, you'd tie up my life vest for me. In the afternoon, sneak me into the lodge so we could steal popsicles.

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: Maybe we could go back. I could drive us up there. We could get a cabin and — And maybe rent a canoe. Oh, wow, I haven't… thought of Spofford in…

utterance.speaker: Elena
utterance.content: Nadia… are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: Elena, I'm sorry! I can't do this!

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: Can you stop? Just stop pushing me for a minute.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I understand now why you stuck yourself in that diner, away from friends, away from family. You can't forgive anyone. I don't think you weigh anything. I think you're like a lot of people. You focus on the bad memories instead of the good.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: I don't have a choice.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Nadia, put your hand in your lap for a moment.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: (looking down at her hand (I'm not doing that.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I know. It's an involuntary movement called choreia.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: What does it mean?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It means, we still don't know what's wrong with you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do you know if that… O.R. nurse that Wilson liked ever broke up with her boyfriend?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I thought your Wilson fetish was over.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm putting together a second string in case things don't go well with the well-breasted barista.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You've gotta let that guy alone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's not supposed to be alone.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Is that what this is about? You feel guilty because Wilson's the one that's alone and not you? You still don't think you deserve this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Have you met me?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Your happiness doesn't take his away. It's okay to enjoy it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Choreia. Rules out the clotting disorder. Means we're back to square one.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: If it's hit her brain, that could mean she doesn't have long.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So then the question becomes, will the sister show up at the funeral?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She tried to reconcile, but the bad memories crowded out the good, and she ran.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nobody's perfect. What else? Come on, the woman has all the information we need. She's a bottomless diagnostic library.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Maybe we're missing something from the apartment. Some lifestyle thing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah, it's all muscle strain from doing her hundreds of Jigsaw puzzles. We should do another MRI. A brain hemorrhage would—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey. How many puzzles?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Okay, I was exaggerating. Dozens.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do a peripheral blood smear. Look for acanthocytes. I'll be right in.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Remember me? Just kidding. So… jigsaw puzzles.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: Um, I find them calming.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You ever left one unfinished?

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: No, that would drive me crazy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Speaking of…

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: Why are you doing that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: More important question is, why are you?

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: It's just a habit.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's a habit that compels you in an obsessive way, that's so bad, it's a disorder.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: I don't have OCD.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Each brain with OCD has its own way of filtering it. Some people wash their hands and hoard TV Guides. You do puzzles and hoard memories.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So what we thought was a gift… is just you literally obsessing over your own life.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: That's why I can't stop the memories, even when I try. But everything else? My kidneys?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Memory was just a symptom of a symptom of a larger disease. You have McLeod syndrome. It's a rare genetic disorder that affects the nervous system, the blood. And can cause… OCD.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: Am I gonna die?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It can't be cured. But your various symptoms can be managed with medication. Best-case scenario, you can live another 20 years.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If it's any solace, everybody dies alone. It probably isn't.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How'd it go?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Well, it's hard to choke when you have all the answers.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Look at it this way. It's better to suck at taking one test than to suck at saving people's lives.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Uh, Rachel thought it was too big, and I can't keep it in my hotel room.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're giving it to me?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I couldn't stand the thought of you having company over with that other TV. It's embarrassing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hey, look, um… I have the room. You could stay, if you wanted to. Just until you find your new place. Who else am I gonna play Savageskate with?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We could do that online from separate houses.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Will you shut up?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How you feeling?

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: Much better.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I don't believe what House said. I'm not sure even House believes it anymore. You said you didn't have a choice to be the way you are. Now you do. These are SSRIs. They've been effective in treating OCD.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: You mean lose my memory?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Not lose it entirely. It'll just become more like anyone else's.

utterance.speaker: Nadia
utterance.content: My memory… is the only thing, that has ever, made me special.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Maybe so. But if you want to be special… you're gonna have to be alone.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Ohh!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Ohh!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Aah!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Those are for Sarah.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Are they poisoned?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Poi— you and your paranoia. Now, if you'll excuse me…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I really should find a better place to store my ragweed.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's a very nice gesture, but it's still in the apartment.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So… I wanna hear all the dirty, dairy-specific details of your night with java the slut.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: All right. First of all, all real. Second… a true connoisseur of the dark arts of… I flaked. I walked her to her car and said good night. I will get back into it, I — you just need to give me a little more time.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'll give you ten days.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ooh!
